intro: Gerardia parviflora, commonly known as the small-flowered gerardia, is a flowering plant native to the Arctic and subarctic regions. It is a member of the Ericaceae family, commonly known as the heath or pine family. This low-growing shrub typically reaches a height of only a few centimeters, with small, dark green leaves. Its flowers are usually pink or white, appearing in clusters at the ends of the stems. Gerardia parviflora is adapted to cold climates and is often found in rocky or sandy soils.
